articles.title: Ever receive a package you didn't order? It could be a scam
articles.description: Third-party sellers on Amazon and other e-commerce sites are sending random products to people across the US as part of what's known as a "brushing scam" -- a bizarre scheme that helps boost a vendors' ratings online. Here's how it works.
